Context:
The Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) is a degree completion pathway for graduates of Ontario college advanced diploma programs in Architectural Technology and Interior Design Technology. This program requires students to complete Years 3 and 4 to obtain their bachelor's degree in Construction Management. The curriculum combines theory, applied research, field study, and hands-on practical education. Students gain knowledge and skills to manage construction projects from start to finish and master construction-related technical disciplines and soft skills.

Graduates are entitled to the academic credential designation of Hons. B.Tech (Construction Management). The program is accredited by the Canadian Institute of Quantity Surveyors (CIQS) and graduates qualify for Gold Seal Certification (GSC) offered by the Canadian Construction Association (CCA).

The mandatory field experience semester is offered in the spring/summer of the third year. Students must complete a minimum of 450 hours of relevant fieldwork experience or equivalent to fulfill the requirement. They can do it through the Field Experience course (TCOP 1001) or Prior Learning Assessment Recognition (PLAR).
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) Program (Bridging) T314 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) program at the college prepares graduates for careers in various roles within the construction industry, including but not limited to: construction manager, project manager, project coordinator, field engineer, site superintendent, estimator, project monitor, building science specialist, building condition assessor, construction sales manager, construction claims specialist, construction quality control specialist, construction health and safety specialist, construction cost consultant, developer, project controls specialist, site inspector, contractor, and subcontractor.

Graduates of this program may be eligible for professional memberships in construction management associations such as the Canadian Institute of Quantity Surveyors (CIQS), Chartered Institute of Building (CIOB), and Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors (RICS). Academic accreditation for this program includes accreditation by CIQS, CIOB, and RICS.

Graduates will have completed all academic requirements for professional membership at CIQS and can apply separately for membership to obtain the Professional Quantity Surveyors (PQS) or Construction Estimator Certified (CEC) designation. The construction industry requires professionals with a comprehensive knowledge of construction safety and quality management systems, sustainable construction practices, and a broad technical and business management background.

Construction managers plan, organize, lead, and control construction projects from start to finish, ensuring compliance with design requirements, contracts, specifications, budgets, schedules, and sustainable construction techniques. The program is fully accredited by CIQS, CIOB, and RICS.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) Program (Bridging) T314 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context: The Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) degree is offered at George Brown College. This degree is respected in the construction sector and graduates can qualify for various certifications such as Quantity Surveyors (PQS) or Construction Estimator Certified (CEC), and Gold Seal Certification (GSC). The Gold Seal Certification is available for superintendents, foremen, estimators, project managers, owner’s construction managers and safety practitioners. Industry leaders like Temple Harris, Vice-Chairman, Gillam Group; Christopher Rick, PCL Constructors, Canada Inc.; James Zippel, General Manager, Electrical Service & Projects, Ainsworth; Greg Kozicz, President, Alberici Constructors, Ltd., and Michael George, President, Trisura Insurance have spoken positively about the Construction Management program at George Brown College. The urgency for this program is due to the rapid change and technology-driven nature of the construction industry.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) Program (Bridging) T314 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context: The Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) program graduates are qualified to pursue graduate studies in relevant fields. Some graduates have attended universities such as Waterloo University, Columbia University, and Toronto Metropolitan University. The required courses for the program include Construction Materials, Construction Surveying, Construction Estimating, Construction Project Scheduling, Highrise Construction Technology, Construction Estimating 3 – Bidding, Construction Health and Safety, Construction Site Engineering, Heavy Construction, Construction Project Accounting, Construction Cost Control, Capstone 1 – Bid Competition, Work Term Preparation 1 and 2, Applications in Building Science, Economics of Project Development, and Preconstruction Cost Planning. Students also complete a summer field experience (Work Term) of 450 hours.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) Program (Bridging) T314 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The text provides information about the course offerings and program learning outcomes for a degree completion pathway in Construction Management at George Brown College. Here is the extracted information:

* The program consists of semesters 1 to 8, with semester 8 being the final semester.
* Some courses have codes (e.g., BLDG 3170, MGMT 4055) and names (e.g., Preconstruction Cost Planning, Construction Labour Relations and Human Resources).
* Courses cover topics such as Project Development, Applications in Building Information Modelling (BIM), Decision Analysis and Critical Thinking, Construction Risk Management, Sustainable Construction, Construction Project Procurement, Leadership and Ethics for Construction Managers, among others.
* Students graduating from Architectural Technology or Interior Design Technology programs at George Brown College, or comparable programs at other Ontario colleges, may be eligible to enter this degree completion pathway.
* The program focuses on various skills and knowledge areas, including communication, analysis, management, leadership, ethics, human resources, and technical problem-solving.
* Courses that have fees in addition to the regular tuition include the field experience semester and some management courses (MGMT 4090, MGMT 4091).
* Students can contact George Brown College for more information at construction_degree@georgebrown.ca or call 416-415-5000, ext. 6297.

Context:
Program Name: Construction Management
Principles and Practices to be applied: business, accounting and financial, construction management, risk assessment and mitigation, documentation management, fair ethics and responsibilities
Domestic Tuition (Fall 2022): $9,524.00
International Tuition (Spring 2024): $20,465.00
Additional Costs: subject to change, fees are estimated based on prior years
Financial Assistance: approved for OSAP funding for eligible applicants
Admission Requirements: Ontario College Advanced diploma in Architectural Technology, program GPA of 3.0 or higher
Special Requirements: laptop with specifications and home Internet service with certain speed and ping time.

The Angelo DelZotto School of Construction Management offers a [Construction Management](name: ConstructionManagement) program. The principles and practices to be applied in this program include business, accounting and financial management, construction management, risk assessment and mitigation, documentation management, and fair ethics and responsibilities. The tuition fees for the domestic students for the first two semesters starting in Fall 2022 is $9,524.00, while international students for the first two semesters starting in Spring 2024 is estimated to be $20,465.00. Additional costs are subject to change and fees are estimated based on prior years. This program is approved for OSAP funding for eligible applicants. Only graduates of an Ontario College Advanced diploma in Architectural Technology with a program GPA of 3.0 or higher will be considered for this program. Students are required to own or purchase a laptop and arrange for home Internet service with certain specifications.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) Program (Bridging) T314 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The text mentions that applicants should have a home Internet service with a speed of 25 to 40 Mbps and a ping time of 20–100 ms. The recommended laptop specifications include an operating system of Windows 10 Home 64-bit English, a processor of 9th Generation Intel® Core™ i7-9750H, 16GB (2x8GB DDR4 2666MHz) memory, a 256GB M.2 PCIe NVMe Solid State Drive and a 1TB 5400 rpm 2.5" SATA Hard Drive for storage, an NVIDIA® GeForce RTX™ 2060 6GB GDDR6 display card, connectivity with 802.11ac WiFi and Bluetooth, ports including HDMI 2.0, SuperSpeed USB 3.1 Gen 1 Type-A and a 2-in-1 SD / MicroMedia Card slot, a minimum screen size of 15.6 inch FHD(1920 x 1080) with 144Hz refresh rate, and audio with a combo headphone / microphone jack. The text advises against purchasing a Mac laptop due to compatibility issues with certain programs.

Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges. Contact information for the Angelo DelZotto School of Construction Management includes a phone number of 416-415-5000, ext. 6297 and an email address of construction_degree@georgebrown.ca. The office hours are 8 a.m. – 4 p.m., room E228. The Centre for Construction and Engineering Technologies (CCET) Industry Liaison Office (ILO) hosts open houses typically in the autumn and spring, and more information can be found on their Construction and Engineering Open House page. George Brown College's general contact information is available by calling 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002.

Applicants are invited to attend on-campus information sessions to meet instructors and staff, ask questions, and experience a George Brown College classroom. Information session sign-ups can be found on the website. Related programs offered by George Brown College are not explicitly mentioned in the text.
